title: Israel, Arab Countries Pledge to Strengthen Ties After Summit
sub_head: Foreign ministers discussed a new Middle East security alliance to contain Iran
body:
SDE BOKER, Israel—A historic gathering of U.S., Israeli and top Arab diplomats concluded Monday with fresh momentum for discussions to create new Middle East defense partnerships, as one-time foes pledged to meet regularly to boost economic and security ties.
Motivated by a shared desire to contain Iran and navigate a shrinking U.S. footprint in the Middle East, Israel’s Foreign Minister Yair Lapid met with his counterparts from Bahrain, Morocco and the United Arab Emirates—three of the Arab countries that normalized relations with Israel in 2020 in the so-called Abraham Accords. U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Egyptian Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry also took part.
